data.title: "Pub With Doughnuts'
data.text: First time her on Saturday 11/12/16 at 2:30 PM. I read about Second Saturday's and wanted to visit Mike's. I was starved having no breakfast. The pub was packed with people only the high tables with high spinner stools were available. It took awhile before a server came to our table. We ordered water which took awhile and then placed an order. The daily soup and biscuits will take  20......minutes...wow I am hungry now......  The ''special'' was suppose to be ''Chicken Pot Pie Soup'' upon visiting the pub the soup was on the regular menu. The SHOCK set in when I read on the menu that the soup was $6.95 a bowl (topped with a in-house made biscuit). Ala crate the biscuits are  two for $2.50 with what tasted like maple butter. The soup of the day ($4.95 a bowl about 2 cup measure I would say) was a squash, bacon and corn chowder. No cracker, no croutons just a soup spoon. The biscuit tasted a lot like Hardee's but smaller and without the crisp delicious buttery bottoms. I would take Hardee's over these but I do like Mike's maple whipped butter. The soup was good but took long 20 minutes to get and I feel is overpriced. The place is loud and sports on the TV'S. The table are very close to each other. The bathroom is your typical ber/pub bathroom with lots of large black and white pictures of actors some even somewhat unclothed. Doughnuts are over priced. Our waiter was excellent ''Brandon''. Ice cream shakes are 1/2 off after 3:00 PM.

data.title: TV's, Donuts & Chicken - Memorable
data.text: Where were you the night the Cubs clinched to finally go to the World Series? For me it was Mike's Donuts & Chicken. This place is truly unique! Our family ended up here when another restaurant had too long of a wait, recommended by my college – aged son. Mike's was buzzing! There was a plethora of TVs throughout. Private parties available upstairs. Sports-book in the back. They had a wall of Jameson bottles that apparently you could buy and store there, a la Japanese restaurants and sake. The Chicken sandwiches are very good. You can get them any way you want. I had mine with dark meat on biscuits. And I recommend fried versus grilled. Coleslaw came on the sandwich, which I loved. I will definitely try this place again. The reasons I gave it a three: They were out of donuts, out of the first two draft beers I chose, and our table could've been cleaner. Also, the service was slow on this night, but that was understandable, given the situation. Despite all that, Danno says, "Book it to Mike's Donuts & Chicken!" It's a casual dining experience that's worth a look!

data.title: Good with a cavet
data.text: We have been going to Donuts and Chicken since they opened and are probably there twice or three times a month.  The last few times I've gone they've been out of stuff.  I get that they were out of the Philly Cheesesteak since they specialize in chicken and I found something to replace it.  The last straw was when I was there on a Monday night to have the special 1/2 price bucket.  We arrived about 6:15 and were told that they were out of chicken breasts to put in the bucket but someone was out buying more.  No problem - we thought - we told the server that we weren't in hurry and we would order one of the $5.00 appetizers (also on special).  Our server was great and kept us posted about the arrival of the chicken.  Finally after 45 minutes or so she asked if we just wanted dark meat.  We agreed to do 4 wings and 4 thigh and legs.  She went to put in order and came back and said they wouldn't do that because they didn't want to compromised the rest of the buckets.  Okay - I even understood that but about 10 minutes later she came back and said they couldn't get any chicken breasts so they were going to do our bucket with dark meat and wings.  Perfect - we finally got out bucket - it was delicious - but really?!? You know it's half price bucket night, you serve chicken breast sandwiches and you don't have chicken?  Can't really understand it. Is there any thought to what you serve or is all your time spent coming up with new doughnut flavors?  Last night we stopped in a for a drink (we ate dinner elsewhere) and they were out of at least 2 of their Octoberfest beers.  Good to Donuts and Chicken - the food when you can get it - is good.  I've always had friendly helpful servers too.  Just don't have your appetite set for something you might not get.

data.title: We weren't disappointed in the donuts!
data.text: After an afternoon on the street car, Choo Choo Charlies, the dinosaur museum and a walk along the sculpture walk, we stopped at Mike's Donuts & Chickens.  You can not miss the donuts when you walk in and there are some really unbelievable looking creations.  But, not only do they look good, they taste good, as well.  We picked out a dozen donuts, but ate a couple there, since with all of the sprinkles and other special crumbs, i.e. cookie pieces and peanut butter cup pieces, we didn't want to eat them in the car.  What could go wrong there?!  The donuts are big and  tasted great, we never got to the chicken.  I have a feeling that we'll be back!

data.title: I love donuts.
data.text: Seriously delicious donuts with fun flavors- we tried English Toffee with Twix and an Almond Joy donut.  My husband had a fried chicken sandwich and I had their portabello mushroom sandwich.  Fun atmosphere and great food!

data.title: Fun outdoor dining, but.....
data.text: Two of us wanted to enjoy the nice day and eat a relaxing lunch outdoors. Found Mike's. We still can't figure out their name: it is (per our waiter) two restaurants sharing the same space: one upstairs and down. (Never saw any donuts.) We had a nice table, lite breeze, a very pleasant and attentive waiter. We enjoyed our good food and drinks. One situation really interfered with our overall experience: a drunken unkempt guy with his dog bothered every table with his swearing, chasing his dog around the tables, and improperly utilizing the restroom. (Unfortunately he happened to come in while I was there.) When we voiced our concerns to our waiter - he noted that the owner/manager(?) feels obligated let him hang around. So I guess you need to either roll with circumstances, be sure he is not on premises when you visit, or eat elsewhere.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Nice people, good, awesome, fantastic donuts! Lots to choose from and genius creations. Next time will try the chicken!!!

data.title: Fun atmosphere, good food
data.text: Mike's Donuts and Chicken has never disappointed. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is always filled with good sing-a-long classic favorites. Ladies, make sure you visit the restroom. There are very attractive pictures you don't want to miss.

data.title: awesome Donuts!
data.text: awesome donuts. Unique flavor combinations. Try the maple bacon for sure. Priced affordable. Great tourist stop too.

data.title: Great Donuts
data.text: We stopped in for lunch on a weekday.  It was moderately busy.  Staff was friendly.  Tried the donut glazed chicken wings - definitely different and quite tasty.  The kids had donuts and raved about them.  The chicken sandwiches were great.  Would definitely come back.

data.title: Decktop visit
data.text: Very nice location to enjoy good food and drinks. Decent menu selection and great choice of a variety of beers. Good service.

data.title: Roof top drinks Sunday mid afternoon
data.text: Really fun bar and restaurant.  Quirky decor, super nice staff, decent beer prices.   I ordered special Margarita, didn't like, waitress took back and didnt  charge.  We will be back.

data.title: Drunken Pig Biscuit
data.text:
The Drunken Pig Biscuit was sweet, spicy, the biscuit, crisp crust flakey center. Very good. Slaw crisp, 
Steven our waited always at our beckon call.

data.title: Can't just eat one!!
data.text: Strolled in for a sweet tooth craving with my wife and I have to say their eye popping donut collection really hit the spot. Not too cake like and not too simplistic, I really recommend going all out here! I'm coming back to hit the chicken dishes up next time.

data.title: DONUTS TO DIE FOR
data.text: Daily donuts provide a wide variety of house regular donuts and a few specialty  donuts made daily also.  Great cup of coffee  and their milk is served from glass bottles just like the old days ! I believe they get it from OBERWIESS Dairies. And don't forget the steak house upstairs...........

data.title: Mike's Donuts & Chicken - Very Confused and Not Going Back
data.text:
My wife, adult son and I were at Mike's Donuts & Chicken on a Saturday around noon and somehow got directed upstairs and onto the outdoor deck. The inside dining area upstairs wasn't busy at all and only three tables were occupied on the deck.
    I had the salmon which was very overcooked and my son had the nachos.  The food order took over an hour to prepare which was confusing due to the fact that they were not very busy.  I did try two craft beers which were warm when they got to our table.
  The deck was filthy dirty with foot traffic and the partial roof looked very over-engineered and the metal was rusting.  My wife was embarrassed by the nude male pictures in her restroom and the old Playboy Magazine covers in the Men's Restroom seemed very distasteful.
After the let down upstairs we decided to try out the downstairs bar area with the walls  being lined with numbered Jameson bottles.  Being confused again, I had to ask the bartender why they were there.  She said that customers would purchase a bottle and she would number it and keep it for them to drink from it at another time.  She made no attempt to give me any further details such as pricing, etc.  The room temperature downstairs was unbearable and I asked the bartender why it was so hot.  She stated "I don't know what's wrong, they have been trying to fix it for a week."   Again, I was confused.  We will never be returning to Mike's Donuts & Chicken.

data.title: Great Dinner Here!
data.text: My wife and I had dinner here recently. After having to wait a long while for our food we were pleasantly surprised when our superb dinner arrived. We had one of the best meals ever and well worth the wait! We will definitely return, yes!

data.title: Not bad
data.text: They do have great food and wonderful servers. We did have to wait half an hour to even get someone to notice we were waiting to have our orders taken and their menu has limited items, but overall the good was great, the atmosphere was nice, and the specialty donuts have all been amazing. (If you go, DEFINITELY try the maple bacon donut. I know it sounds weird, but trust me. It is definitely worth the try.)

data.title: Yum!
data.text: We went for breakfast, and the maple bacon donuts are incredible! Eggs were cooked to order perfectly, and our waitress was delightful. We'll be back again for sure.

data.title: Home feel for the guy out of town
data.text: All the good aspects of a big city sports bar, and your local corner spot. Comfort foods are served in continually innovative ways and the building in itself is a artistic continual effort that reminds me of California with the modern approach. The second floor is a view that regardless of the weather you should put on the list of things to do
